description: One (free) MCP for the Web. Easily search, crawl, navigate, and extract websites without getting blocked. Ideal for discovering and retrieving structured insights from any public source - effortlessly and ethically.

token.description: Bright Data API key, available in https://brightdata.com/cp/setting/users

browser.description: Optional: Zone name for the Browser API (enables browser control tools, defaults to 'mcp_browser')

unlocker.description: Optional: The Web Unlocker zone name (defaults to 'mcp_unlocker')

tools.name: search_engine
tools.description: Scrape search results from Google, Bing or Yandex. Returns SERP results in JSON or Markdown (URL, title, description), Ideal forgathering current information, news, and detailed search results.

tools.name: scrape_as_markdown
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in MarkDown language. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: search_engine_batch
tools.description: Run multiple search queries simultaneously. Returns JSON for Google, Markdown for Bing/Yandex.

tools.name: scrape_batch
tools.description: Scrape multiple webpages URLs with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in MarkDown language. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: scrape_as_html
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in HTML. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: session_stats
tools.description: Tell the user about the tool usage during this session

tools.name: web_data_amazon_product
tools.description:
Quickly read structured amazon product data.
Requires a valid product URL with /dp/ in it.
This can be a cache lookup, so it can be more reliable than scraping

tools.name: scraping_browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate a scraping browser session to a new URL

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_back
tools.description: Go back to the previous page

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_forward
tools.description: Go forward to the next page

tools.name: scraping_browser_snapshot
tools.description:
Capture an ARIA snapshot of the current page showing all interactive elements with their refs.
This provides accurate element references that can be used with ref-based tools.
Use this before interacting with elements to get proper refs instead of guessing selectors.

filtered.description: Whether to apply filtering/compaction (default: false). Set to true to get a compacted version of the snapshot.

tools.name: scraping_browser_click_ref
tools.description:
Click on an element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot.
Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values.
This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

ref.description: The ref attribute from the ARIA snapshot (e.g., "23")

element.description: Description of the element being clicked for context

tools.name: scraping_browser_type_ref
tools.description:
Type text into an element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot.
Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values.
This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

ref.description: The ref attribute from the ARIA snapshot (e.g., "23")

submit.description: Whether to submit the form after typing (press Enter)

element.description: Description of the element being typed into for context

tools.name: scraping_browser_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page

full_page.description:
Whether to screenshot the full page (default: false)
You should avoid fullscreen if it's not important, since the images can be quite large

tools.name: scraping_browser_network_requests
tools.description:
Get all network requests made since loading the current page.
Shows HTTP method, URL, status code and status text for each request.
Useful for debugging API calls, tracking data fetching, and understanding page behavior.

tools.name: scraping_browser_wait_for_ref
tools.description:
Wait for an element to be visible using its ref from the ARIA snapshot.
Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values.
This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

ref.description: The ref attribute from the ARIA snapshot (e.g., "23")

element.description: Description of the element being waited for

timeout.description: Maximum time to wait in milliseconds (default: 30000)

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_text
tools.description: Get the text content of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_html
tools.description: Get the HTML content of the current page. Avoid using this tool and if used, use full_page option unless it is important to see things like script tags since this can be large

full_page.description:
Whether to get the full page HTML including head and script tags
Avoid this if you only need the extra HTML, since it can be quite large

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll
tools.description: Scroll to the bottom of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll_to_ref
tools.description:
Scroll to a specific element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot.
Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values.
This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

ref.description: The ref attribute from the ARIA snapshot (e.g., "23")

element.description: Description of the element to scroll to
